author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Summer 1993’ Review: Darkness Under the Spanish Sun
text:
Much of the magic of being a movie star lies in stillness—reacting subtly, or not at all, while the audience projects what it will onto your face. Laia Artigas doesn’t qualify as a star quite yet; she plays Frida, the 6-year-old heroine of “Summer 1993,” in Spanish with English subtitles. But her sweet, still features tell a tale of torment and growth in this autobiographical, and startlingly astute, debut feature by Carla Simón.
Before the movie begins, Frida’s life has been transformed by two deaths—her father’s, and then...
